div.p: Through the course of the school year, winter weather conditions or unexpected circumstances like interruptions to our utility services may require Young Scholars to delay the opening of school or close school for the day.

Parents and guardians can find announcements about Young Scholars closings and delays on local radio and TV stations: WPXI, WTAE, and KDKA. You can get up-to-the-minute school delay and closure information by receiving automated phone calls, texts, and/or emails from the Young Scholars message system, SchoolReach. You can also follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

Please note: School is canceled only during unusual circumstances such as extreme weather, facilities or equipment failure, an environmental hazard, or a public crisis that causes a significant safety risk. In the case of weather, Young Scholars considers either Pittsburgh Public Schools or Baldwin-Whitehall Schools when scheduling delays and closings.

div.h1: Find school closings and delays on local radio and TV stations

div.p: Or follow us on Facebook and Twitter

div.div: How do I find out if Young Scholars will have a 2-hour delay or close for the day?

div.p: Young Scholars uses a messenger program called SchoolReach that calls home phone numbers, texts mobile numbers, and sends emails when these decisions have been made. We also post changes to the school schedule on our homepage and our Facebook and Twitter pages.

Parents and guardians can tune into the following television stations for school closing and delay announcements as well: WPXI, WTAE, and KDKA. These stations carry a moving line across the bottom of the screen to provide school closing information.
Neither Young Scholars nor the media announce when schools are going to be open. If there is no announcement through these channels, classes are in session and on schedule.

div.div: When will I know if schools are closed or on a 2-hour delay?

div.p: When a decision can be made the preceding night we attempt to make an announcement by 10 p.m. In most cases, however, decisions aren’t made until morning. The goal is to make a decision to have a 2-hour delay or close schools by 5.30 a.m.
There will be no announcement if school will be open on schedule.

div.div: What if school is open but I decide to keep my child home during inclement weather?

div.p: If we decide to open school, parents and guardians have the option to keep their children home for health and safety reasons. Parents and guardians are ultimately responsible for making this decision.

Parents and guardians who decide to keep their children home in this or any other situation should call school to report their child’s absence. As with any absence, they must provide a written excuse to their child’s teacher within three days of his or her return to school, or we will record the absence as unexcused or unlawful. See page 26 of our Parent-Student Handbook for full information on how to handle absences.

div.div: What time should my child report to school when there is a 2-hour delay?

div.p: In the instance of a 2-hour delay, all students must report to school no later than 2 hours after our normal start time of 8:12 a.m. Thus, all children should report to school by 10:12 a.m.
The same is true for the time students should report to the bus stop. If a child’s normal bus pick up time is 7:00 a.m., the child should report to his or her stop by 9:00 a.m.

div.div: What happens if the weather worsens during the school day?

div.p: We try to avoid unexpected early dismissals. However, on occasion, early dismissal is unavoidable. We provide as much advance notice as possible, and we contact local media when it is necessary to dismiss children during the regular school day.

Parents and guardians should make prior arrangements for supervision of their children in cases of unplanned early dismissals. It is important for us to be able to reach parents, guardians, and designated childcare providers during daytime hours. Parents and guardians should make sure we have accurate telephone numbers and emergency contact information for them and their alternate contacts.

p.strong: If weather conditions worsen and school remains open, parents and guardians may choose to pick up their children early after informing school staff.

div.div: What cold weather provisions are made for recess?

div.p: The decision to hold recess during poor weather conditions, including extreme cold, is made by the principal. Children should always wear appropriate cold weather clothing, including winter coats, hats, gloves or mittens, and boots during the winter months.
Any student with a health concern that requires him or her to stay indoors should provide a doctor’s note to the school. Appropriate accommodations will be made to meet the needs of the child.

div.div: What provisions are made for after-school activities when Young Scholars has a 2-hour delay or is closed?

div.p: All school-sponsored after-school activities are cancelled when an early dismissal or school closing occurs.
After-school activities may or may not be cancelled in the case of a 2-hour delay. We will issue an announcement in a timely manner if these activities will be cancelled for the day.
